## Public Member Functions

### changesLength() {#a075f39a7a4718844c3f0e0930715414d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::sandboxir::ShuffleVectorInst::changesLength () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return true if this shuffle returns a vector with a different number of elements than its source vectors.

Examples: shufflevector &lt;4 x n&gt; A, &lt;4 x n&gt; B, &lt;1,2,3&gt; shufflevector &lt;4 x n&gt; A, &lt;4 x n&gt; B, &lt;1,2,3,4,5&gt;

### isSelect() {#ae3c3174242fb6e6a4c1267aa36f0f131}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::sandboxir::ShuffleVectorInst::isSelect () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return true if this shuffle chooses elements from its source vectors without lane crossings and all operands have the same number of elements.

In other words, this shuffle is equivalent to a vector select with a constant condition operand. Example: shufflevector &lt;4 x n&gt; A, &lt;4 x n&gt; B, &lt;undef,1,6,3&gt; This returns false if the mask does not choose from both input vectors. In that case, the shuffle is better classified as an identity shuffle.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h/#l00689">689</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h">Instruction.h</a>.

### isBitRotateMask() {#a7692cb204bee86bea3cb7f41a580347b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool llvm::sandboxir::ShuffleVectorInst::isBitRotateMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, unsigned EltSizeInBits, unsigned MinSubElts, unsigned MaxSubElts, unsigned &amp; NumSubElts, unsigned &amp; RotateAmt)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Checks if the shuffle is a bit rotation of the first operand across multiple subelements, e.g:

shuffle &lt;8 x i8&gt; a, &lt;8 x i8&gt; poison, &lt;8 x i32&gt; &lt;1, 0, 3, 2, 5, 4, 7, 6&gt;

could be expressed as

rotl &lt;4 x i16&gt; a, 8

If it can be expressed as a rotation, returns the number of subelements to group by in NumSubElts and the number of bits to rotate left in RotateAmt.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h/#l00951">951</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h">Instruction.h</a>.

### isIdentityMask() {#a12ffa0b5875610369046b023b0e3b7ca}

  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Return true if this shuffle mask chooses elements from exactly one source vector without lane crossings.

A shuffle using this mask is not necessarily a no-op because it may change the number of elements from its input vectors or it may provide demanded bits knowledge via undef lanes. Example: &lt;undef,undef,2,3&gt;

### isInsertSubvectorMask() {#aaac6402d988a5e91be8fed57216a6809}

Return true if this shuffle mask is an insert subvector mask.

A valid insert subvector mask inserts the lowest elements of a second source operand into an in-place first source operand. Both the sub vector width and the insertion index is returned.

### isInterleaveMask() {#a1befcfac778c8aaa7cab09de808cbcb7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool llvm::sandboxir::ShuffleVectorInst::isInterleaveMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, unsigned Factor, unsigned NumInputElts, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; &amp; StartIndexes)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Return true if the mask interleaves one or more input vectors together.

I.e. &lt;0, LaneLen, ... , LaneLen&#42;(Factor - 1), 1, LaneLen + 1, ...&gt; E.g. For a Factor of 2 (LaneLen=4): &lt;0, 4, 1, 5, 2, 6, 3, 7&gt; E.g. For a Factor of 3 (LaneLen=4): &lt;4, 0, 9, 5, 1, 10, 6, 2, 11, 7, 3, 12&gt; E.g. For a Factor of 4 (LaneLen=2): &lt;0, 2, 6, 4, 1, 3, 7, 5&gt;

NumInputElts is the total number of elements in the input vectors.

StartIndexes are the first indexes of each vector being interleaved, substituting any indexes that were undef E.g. &lt;4, -1, 2, 5, 1, 3&gt; (Factor=3): StartIndexes=&lt;4, 0, 2&gt;

Note that this does not check if the input vectors are consecutive: It will return true for masks such as &lt;0, 4, 6, 1, 5, 7&gt; (Factor=3, LaneLen=2)

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h/#l00916">916</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h">Instruction.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isOneUseSingleSourceMask() {#a252c430f2d2ac65ad395418c6e4bf924}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool llvm::sandboxir::ShuffleVectorInst::isOneUseSingleSourceMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, int VF)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Return true if this shuffle mask represents &quot;clustered&quot; mask of size VF, i.e.

each index between &#91;0..VF) is used exactly once in each submask of size VF. For example, the mask for <code>VF=4</code> is: 0, 1, 2, 3, 3, 2, 0, 1 - &quot;clustered&quot;, because each submask of size 4 (0,1,2,3 and 3,2,0,1) uses indices &#91;0..VF) exactly one time. 0, 1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 1, 0 - not &quot;clustered&quot;, because element 3 is used twice in the second submask (3,3,1,0) and index 2 is not used at all.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h/#l00875">875</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h">Instruction.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

For example, the mask for <code>ReplicationFactor=3</code> and <code>VF=4</code> is: &lt;0,0,0,1,1,1,2,2,2,3,3,3&gt;

### isSelectMask() {#a878990f42d3da1f18e414eab4d325f4e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool llvm::sandboxir::ShuffleVectorInst::isSelectMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, int NumSrcElts)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Return true if this shuffle mask chooses elements from its source vectors without lane crossings.

A shuffle using this mask would be equivalent to a vector select with a constant condition operand. Example: &lt;4,1,6,undef&gt; This returns false if the mask does not choose from both input vectors. In that case, the shuffle is better classified as an identity shuffle. This assumes that vector operands are the same length as the mask (a length-changing shuffle can never be equivalent to a vector select).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h/#l00674">674</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h">Instruction.h</a>.

### isTransposeMask() {#a28026e5094b94a512f9116384eed7c93}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool llvm::sandboxir::ShuffleVectorInst::isTransposeMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, int NumSrcElts)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Return true if this shuffle mask is a transpose mask.

Transpose vector masks transpose a 2xn matrix. They read corresponding even- or odd-numbered vector elements from two n-dimensional source vectors and write each result into consecutive elements of an n-dimensional destination vector. Two shuffles are necessary to complete the transpose, one for the even elements and another for the odd elements. This description closely follows how the TRN1 and TRN2 <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aarch64">AArch64</a> instructions operate.

For example, a simple 2x2 matrix can be transposed with:

; Original matrix m0 = &lt; a, b &gt; m1 = &lt; c, d &gt;

; Transposed matrix t0 = &lt; a, c &gt; = shufflevector m0, m1, &lt; 0, 2 &gt; t1 = &lt; b, d &gt; = shufflevector m0, m1, &lt; 1, 3 &gt;

For matrices having greater than n columns, the resulting nx2 transposed matrix is stored in two result vectors such that one vector contains interleaved elements from all the even-numbered rows and the other vector contains interleaved elements from all the odd-numbered rows. For example, a 2x4 matrix can be transposed with:

; Original matrix m0 = &lt; a, b, c, d &gt; m1 = &lt; e, f, g, h &gt;

; Transposed matrix t0 = &lt; a, e, c, g &gt; = shufflevector m0, m1 &lt; 0, 4, 2, 6 &gt; t1 = &lt; b, f, d, h &gt; = shufflevector m0, m1 &lt; 1, 5, 3, 7 &gt;

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h/#l00766">766</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h">Instruction.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool llvm::sandboxir::ShuffleVectorInst::isTransposeMask (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/constant">Constant</a> &#42; Mask, int NumSrcElts)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h/#l00769">769</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/instruction-h">Instruction.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
